sense.name: fall short of a goal, not succeed, cause to not succeed
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP FAIL [predicate] NP1[agent] FAIL NP2 Either the agent is aware of the intended goal, or someone describing the failed goal was expecting it (as in the case of predicted events specified by a theory)
sense.examples: Why is the public school system failing? Her confidence failed her at the audition and she didn't get the job. Try as I would, I failed to understand the poetry of Ezra Pound. That math professor failed his whole class. John never studied the material and so he failed the class. She failed to be a good daughter to him.

sense.name: give out, stop functioning
sense.examples: The engines failed during take-off. Three banks failed in our state last month. The water supply for the town failed after a long drought. Her grandfather's health is failing.

sense.name: neglect,leave undone
sense.commentary: Note: Implies the agent was not aware of the action that needed attention
sense.examples: She failed to turn the heat down while stirring the pudding. I failed to leave the key under the mat for the cleaning lady.
